and you need an updated version openssh?
yes. its 4.7 way out of date
you could change your /etc/apt/sources  to the latest ubuntu version
then switch your sources back again
it usually works :-D  if it tries to update your entire system, then cancel :-D
but if it only wants to upgrade a few packages, it's probably fine
to be safe, you could write down the list of packages that it installs.  If it screws up, just remove those packages and reinstall (with the apt/sources.conf pointing to the 8.10 repos)
just being "supported" doesn't mean it has the latest packages up to that point
openssh would have _only_ been upgraded if there was a serious security flaw
